channel.title: Bio on Mustafa Dane's Personal Website
channel.description: Recent content in Bio on Mustafa Dane's Personal Website

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Hey! This is Mustafa. I am a software engineer with a strong passion to coding, learning, and teaching which makes me a constant learner. I like learning new languages, technologies, and libraries. I often find myself reading blog posts about other technologies, watching tutorials, and tinkering with new techs by coding with them!

Currently, I work as a Teaching Fellow at Fullstack Academy of Code in Chicago where I graduated a few months ago. I enjoy teaching coding and algorithms; also weirdly, debugging. I know, right? Sometimes I respect bugs as they take our precious hours where we are dealing with bloody deadlines. And once I found it, I am like uh-huh, there you are! Now, get out of my code! At Fullstack Academy, I daily help students to debug their codes and it is the best feeling when you see the students amazed after finding the bug.

If I am not coding, I might be snowboarding, rollerblading, or flying my drone (In fact, background image of this page was taken by my drone).

Please check my GitHub Profile for my work: https://www.github.com/mustafadane

Education

  • 2018 - Software Engineering Immersive Certificate, Fullstack Academy of Code

  • 2017 - PhD level courses, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign

  • 2015 - B.S. in Molecular Biology and Genetics, Bogazici University, Istanbul, Turkey

Places I’ve worked

  • 2019 - Present- Software Engineer and Teaching Fellow, Fullstack Academy of Code, Chicago, IL

  • 2015 - 2017 - Research Assistant, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign

  • 2014 - Research Assistant, Harvard University, Cambridge, MA

  • 2013 - Research Assistant, University of California, San Diego, CA

My Skills

JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML5, CSS, Python, C, Node.js, React, React Native, Redux, Express, Expo, OOP, TDD, APIs, AJAX, Agile, Pair programming, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Firebase Real-time Database, Sequelize, Mocha, Chai, Enzyme, Socket.io, Webpack, Babel.js, Git, GitHub
